com.tomtom.speedtools.json

Class SimpleJsonSerializer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomtom.speedtools.json.SimpleJsonSerializer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleMongoDBSerializer

    public class SimpleJsonSerializer
extends Object
    Simple POJO (Plain Old Java Object, or 'regular Java object') to JSON object mapper. It is lenient, invalid values may be discarded or an exception can be thrown (customizable).

    For non JSON-type fields, the serializer returns a Java Map object that contains the JSON representation of the supplied POJO. However, This mapper may be overridden to generate other forms of JSON map objects, such as a MongoDB DBObject (which effectively is also a JSON map object). To do so, override the createJsonMappedObject() method.

      • getInstance

        @Nonnull
public static SimpleJsonSerializer getInstance()
        Get singleton instance of this class.
        Returns:

      • serialize

        @Nullable
public Object serialize(@Nullable
                                  Object pojo)
        Serialize a POJO into a JSON value object.
        Parameters:
        pojo - POJO to serialize.
        Returns:
        JSON mapped object, or null if serialization failed.

      • deserialize

        @Nullable
public Object deserialize(@Nullable
                                    Object jsonValue)
        Given a JSON value object, deserialize it into a POJO.
        Parameters:
        jsonValue - JSON mapped object to deserialize.
        Returns:
        POJO object. If deserialization failed, the return value is null. If the serialized object was null, however, the deserialized object is also null.

      • toStringPretty

        @Nonnull
public String toStringPretty(@Nullable
                                      Object pojo,
                                      boolean pretty)
        Convert a POJO to JSON string object. Note that there is no method to read the JSON string representation and deserialize it. It is primarily used for logging.

        Also note that the string representation includes additional tags for class/type names, unnamed values and such. As such, it is not compatible with other JSON frameworks, such as Jackson, and is not suitable for use in JSON web responses, for example.

        Parameters:
        pojo - POJO to convert.
        pretty - True for pretty printing (indented).
        Returns:
        JSON string representation of POJO.

      • toString

        @Nonnull
public String toString(@Nullable
                                Object pojo)
        Same as toStringPretty(Object, boolean), without pretty printing.
        Parameters:
        pojo - POJO to convert.
        Returns:
        JSON string representation of POJO.

      • createJsonMappedObject

        @Nonnull
protected Map<String,Object> createJsonMappedObject()
        Create a new JSON mapped object. Note that this object can be overridden by derived implementations to, for example, create a MongoDB JSON object.
        Returns:
        New, empty JSON mapped object.

      • determineMapperFromRawType

        @Nullable
protected SimpleJsonSerializer.Mapper determineMapperFromRawType(@Nonnull
                                                                           Class<?> rawType)
        Determine the mapper for a given raw type. You can override this method to add additional mappers. You don't need to call super.determineMapperFromRawType() in that case.
        Parameters:
        rawType - Object type.
        Returns:
        Always null (needs to be overridden in order to be useful).
